page.title: 15RED SMIDDY KENNELS
page.content: The Red Smiddy is a well known local landmark.The house is to be found to the north of the area and is just off a busy roundabout,about three miles from Inchinnan. The building has been used for many ventures since it was built-from the original blacksmith's shop to the present day breeding and boarding kennels. The present owners have been there for three years and breed rough haired collies-"Janman".At the moment they have one dog-called Tommy-and four bitches.The dogs are bought by people wishing a dog for show,or merely as a family pet.Prices range from Â£85 to well over Â£100 for a top dog. The boarding kennels at this moment are being extended and eventually it is hoped to board up to 40 dogs at a time.
